title: Sarong, 18th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: Plain weave. Application of mordants and resist by hand held implement for reds and blue; yellow probably applied directly by brush. Technique very close if not same as for "chintz" dyed in India.
dimensions: Warp x Weft (weft 2 lengths sewn together): 374 x 197.5 cm (147 1/4 x 77 3/4 in.)
description: The field is an all-over pattern of octagons and squares on a white background; side borders are floral; end borders are 3 main pendent bands on deep purple, red and blue backgrounds. The pendants incorporate temple figures.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sarong, 18th century.
18th century. Medium: cotton
Technique: Plain weave. Application of mordants and resist by hand held implement for reds and blue; yellow probably applied directly by brush. Technique very close if not same as for "chintz" dyed in India.. Gift of Jacques Mohr. 1976-32-7.
